src/components/containers/Accordion/Acco.description: An accordion allows users to toggle the display of sections of content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

activeIndex.description: Index of the currently active panel.

exclusive.description: Only allow one panel open at a time.

fluid.description: Format to take up the width of it's container.

type.name: custom

panels.description:
Create simple accordion panels from an array of { text: <string>, content: <custom> } objects.
Object can optionally define an `active` key to open/close the panel.
Object can opitonally define a `key` key used for title and content nodes' keys.
Mutually exclusive with children.
TODO: AccordionPanel should be a sub-component

styled.description: Adds some basic styling to accordion panels.

src/components/containers/Accordion/Acco.description: A content sub-component for Accordion component.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: Whether or not the content is visible.

src/components/containers/Accordion/Acco.description: A title sub-component for Accordion component.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: Whether or not the title is in the open state.

src/components/containers/Card/Card.jsx.description: A card displays site content in a manner similar to a playing card.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

centered.description: A Card can center itself inside its container.

color.description: A Card can be formatted to display different colors.

extra.description: Shorthand for primary content of CardContent.

fluid.description: A Card can be formatted to take up the width of its container.

href.description: Render as an `a` tag instead of a `div` and adds the href attribute.

image.description: A card can contain an Image component.

link.description: A card can be formatted to link to other content.

raised.description: A Card can be formatted to raise above the page.

src/components/containers/Card/CardConte.description: A card can contain blocks of content or extra content meant to be formatted separately from the main content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

extra.description: A card can contain extra content meant to be formatted separately from the main content.

src/components/containers/Card/CardDescr.description: A card can contain a description with one or more paragraphs.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).
An element type to render as (string or function).

doubling.description: A group of cards can double its column width for mobile.

items.description: Shorthand array of props for Card.

itemsPerRow.description: A group of cards can set how many cards should exist in a row.

stackable.description: A group of cards can automatically stack rows to a single columns on mobile devices.

src/components/containers/Card/CardHeade.description: A card can contain a header.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/containers/Card/CardMeta..description: A card can contain content metadata.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/containers/Container/Cont.description: A container limits content to a maximum width.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

text.description: Reduce maximum width to more naturally accommodate text.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

additionLabel.description: Label prefixed to an option added by a user.

additionPosition.description: Position of the `Add: ...` option in the dropdown list ('top' or 'bottom').

allowAdditions.description:
Allow user additions to the list of options (boolean).
Requires the use of `selection`, `options` and `search`.

basic.description: A Dropdown can reduce its complexity.

button.description: Format the Dropdown to appear as a button.

type.name: custom
type.raw:
customPropTypes.every([
  customPropTypes.disallow(['options', 'selection']),
  customPropTypes.givenProps(
    { children: PropTypes.any.isRequired },
    React.PropTypes.element.isRequired,
  ),
])

closeOnBlur.description: Whether or not the menu should close when the dropdown is blurred.

closeOnChange.description:
Whether or not the menu should close when a value is selected from the dropdown.
By default, multiple selection dropdowns will remain open on change, while single
selection dropdowns will close on change.

compact.description: A compact dropdown has no minimum width.

type.name: custom
type.raw:
customPropTypes.every([ // eslint-disable-line react/no-unused-prop-types
  customPropTypes.demand(['multiple']),
  PropTypes.oneOfType([
    PropTypes.number,
    PropTypes.string,
  ]),
])

defaultValue.description: Initial value or value array if multiple.

disabled.description: A disabled dropdown menu or item does not allow user interaction.

error.description: An errored dropdown can alert a user to a problem.

floating.description: A dropdown menu can contain floated content.

fluid.description: A dropdown can take the full width of its parent

header.description: A dropdown menu can contain a header.

inline.description: A dropdown can be formatted to appear inline in other content.

item.description: A dropdown can be formatted as a Menu item.

loading.description: A dropdown can show that it is currently loading data.

multiple.description: A selection dropdown can allow multiple selections.

name.description: Name of the hidden input which holds the value.

noResultsMessage.description: Message to display when there are no results.

open.description: Controls whether or not the dropdown menu is displayed.

openOnFocus.description: Whether or not the menu should open when the dropdown is focused.

options.description: Array of Dropdown.Item props e.g. `{ text: '', value: '' }`

pointing.description: A dropdown can be formatted so that its menu is pointing.

scrolling.description: A dropdown can have its menu scroll.

search.description:
A selection dropdown can allow a user to search through a large list of choices.
Pass a function here to replace the default search.

selectOnBlur.description: Define whether the highlighted item should be selected on blur.

type.name: custom
type.raw:
customPropTypes.every([ // eslint-disable-line react/no-unused-prop-types
  customPropTypes.demand(['multiple']),
  PropTypes.oneOfType([
    PropTypes.string,
    PropTypes.number,
  ]),
])

selection.description: A dropdown can be used to select between choices in a form.

simple.description: A simple dropdown can open without Javascript.

text.description: The text displayed in the dropdown, usually for the active item.

trigger.description: Custom element to trigger the menu to become visible. Takes place of 'text'.

value.description: Current value or value array if multiple. Creates a controlled component.

src/components/containers/Dropdown/Dropd.description: A dropdown menu can contain dividers to separate related content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/containers/Dropdown/Dropd.description: A dropdown menu can contain a header.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function)

active.description: Style as the currently chosen item.

disabled.description: A dropdown item can be disabled.

selected.description:
The item currently selected by keyboard shortcut.
This is not the active item.

src/components/containers/Dropdown/Dropd.description: A dropdown menu can contain a menu.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).
An element type to render as (string or function).

error.description: Automatically show any error Message children.

inverted.description: A form can have its color inverted for contrast.

reply.description: A comment can contain a form to reply to a comment. This may have arbitrary content.

size.description: A form can vary in size.

success.description: Automatically show any success Message children.

warning.description: Automatically show any warning Message children .

widths.description: Forms can automatically divide fields to be equal width.

A form control component (i.e. Dropdown) or HTML tagName (i.e. 'input').

inline.description: A field can have its label next to instead of above it.

required.description: A field can show that input is mandatory.

width.description: A field can specify its width in grid columns

A set of fields can appear grouped together.

inline.description: Multiple fields may be inline in a row.

widths.description: Fields Groups can specify their width in grid columns or automatically divide fields to be equal width.

animated.description: A list can animate to set the current item apart from the list.

bulleted.description: A list can mark items with a bullet.

celled.description: A list can divide its items into cells.

divided.description: A list can show divisions between content.

floated.description: An list can be floated left or right.

horizontal.description: A list can be formatted to have items appear horizontally.

inverted.description: A list can be inverted to appear on a dark background.

items.description: Shorthand array of props for ListItem.

link.description: A list can be specially formatted for navigation links.

ordered.description: A list can be ordered numerically.

relaxed.description: A list can relax its padding to provide more negative space.

selection.description: A selection list formats list items as possible choices.

size.description: A list can vary in size.

verticalAlign.description: An element inside a list can be vertically aligned.

src/components/containers/List/ListConte.description: A list item can contain a content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

floated.description: An list content can be floated left or right.

verticalAlign.description: An element inside a list can be vertically aligned.

src/components/containers/List/ListDescr.description: A list item can contain a description.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/containers/List/ListHeade.description: A list item can contain a header.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/containers/List/ListIcon..description: A list item can contain an icon.

verticalAlign.description: An element inside a list can be vertically aligned.

src/components/containers/List/ListItem..description: A list item can contain a set of items.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

content.description:
Shorthand for primary content.

Heads up!

This is handled slightly differently than the typical `content` prop since
the wrapping ListContent is not used when there's no icon or image.

If you pass content as:
- an element/literal, it's treated as the sibling node to
header/description (whether wrapped in Item.Content or not).
- a props object, it forces the presence of Item.Content and passes those
props to it. If you pass a content prop within that props object, it
will be treated as the sibling node to header/description.

value.description: A value for an ordered list.

src/components/containers/List/ListList..description: A list can contain a sub list.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/containers/Message/Messag.description:
A message displays information that explains nearby content.
@see Form

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

attached.description: A message can be formatted to attach itself to other content.

color.description: A message can be formatted to be different colors.

compact.description: A message can only take up the width of its content.

error.description: A message may be formatted to display a negative message. Same as `negative`.

floating.description: A message can float above content that it is related to.

icon.description: A message can contain an icon.

info.description: A message may be formatted to display information.

list.description: Array shorthand items for the MessageList. Mutually exclusive with children.

negative.description: A message may be formatted to display a negative message. Same as `error`.

positive.description: A message may be formatted to display a positive message.  Same as `success`.

success.description: A message may be formatted to display a positive message.  Same as `positive`.

size.description: A message can have different sizes.

visible.description: A message can be set to visible to force itself to be shown.

warning.description: A message may be formatted to display warning messages.

basic.description: A modal can reduce its complexity

closeOnDimmerClick.description: Whether or not the Modal should close when the dimmer is clicked.

closeOnDocumentClick.description: Whether or not the Modal should close when the document is clicked.

mountNode.description: The node where the modal should mount. Defaults to document.body.

src/components/containers/Segment/Segmen.description: A segment is used to create a grouping of related content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

attached.description: Attach segment to other content, like a header.

basic.description: A basic segment has no special formatting.

clearing.description: A segment can clear floated content.

compact.description: A segment may take up only as much space as is necessary.

disabled.description: A segment may show its content is disabled.

floated.description: Segment content can be floated to the left or right.

inverted.description: A segment can have its colors inverted for contrast.

loading.description: A segment may show its content is being loaded.

padded.description: A segment can increase its padding.

piled.description: Formatted to look like a pile of pages.

raised.description: A segment may be formatted to raise above the page.

secondary.description: A segment can be formatted to appear less noticeable.

size.description: A segment can have different sizes.

stacked.description: Formatted to show it contains multiple pages.

tertiary.description: A segment can be formatted to appear even less noticeable.

textAlign.description: Formats content to be aligned as part of a vertical group.

vertical.description: Formats content to be aligned vertically.

src/components/containers/Segment/Segmen.description: A group of segments can be formatted to appear together.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

compact.description: A segment may take up only as much space as is necessary.

horizontal.description: Formats content to be aligned horizontally.

piled.description: Formatted to look like a pile of pages.

raised.description: A segment group may be formatted to raise above the page.

size.description: A segment group can have different sizes.

stacked.description: Formatted to show it contains multiple pages.

src/components/containers/Table/Table.js.description: A table displays a collections of data grouped into rows.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

basic.description: A table can reduce its complexity to increase readability.

celled.description: A table may be divided each row into separate cells.

collapsing.description: A table can be collapsing, taking up only as much space as its rows.

color.description: A table can be given a color to distinguish it from other tables.

columns.description: A table can specify its column count to divide its content evenly.

compact.description: A table may sometimes need to be more compact to make more rows visible at a time.

definition.description: A table may be formatted to emphasize a first column that defines a rows content.

fixed.description: A table can use fixed a special faster form of table rendering that does not resize table cells based on content

footerRow.description: Shorthand for a TableRow to be placed within Table.Footer.

headerRow.description: Shorthand for a TableRow to be placed within Table.Header.

inverted.description: A table's colors can be inverted.

padded.description: A table may sometimes need to be more padded for legibility.

selectable.description: A table can have its rows appear selectable.

singleLine.description: A table can specify that its cell contents should remain on a single line and not wrap.

size.description: A table can also be small or large.

sortable.description: A table may allow a user to sort contents by clicking on a table header.

stackable.description: A table can specify how it stacks table content responsively.

striped.description: A table can stripe alternate rows of content with a darker color to increase contrast.

structured.description: A table can be formatted to display complex structured data.

tableData.description: Data to be passed to the renderBodyRow function.

textAlign.description: A table can adjust its text alignment.

unstackable.description: A table can specify how it stacks table content responsively.

verticalAlign.description: A table can adjust its text alignment.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: A cell can be active or selected by a user.

collapsing.description: A cell can be collapsing so that it only uses as much space as required.

error.description: A cell may call attention to an error or a negative value.

icon.description: Add an Icon by name, props object, or pass an <Icon />

negative.description: A cell may let a user know whether a value is bad.

positive.description: A cell may let a user know whether a value is good.

singleLine.description: A cell can specify that its contents should remain on a single line and not wrap.

textAlign.description: A table cell can adjust its text alignment.

verticalAlign.description: A table cell can adjust its text alignment.

warning.description: A cell may warn a user.

width.description: A table can specify the width of individual columns independently.

src/components/containers/Table/TableFoo.description: A table can have a footer.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

sorted.description: A header cell can be sorted in ascending or descending order.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: A row can be active or selected by a user.

cellAs.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

cells.description: Shorthand array of props for TableCell.

error.description: A row may call attention to an error or a negative value.

negative.description: A row may let a user know whether a value is bad.

positive.description: A row may let a user know whether a value is good.

active.description: A button can show it is currently the active user selection.

animated.description: A button can animate to show hidden content.

attached.description: A button can be attached to the top or bottom of other content.

basic.description: A basic button is less pronounced.

color.description: A button can have different colors

compact.description: A button can reduce its padding to fit into tighter spaces.

attached.description: A button can be attached to the top or bottom of other content.

checked.description: Whether or not checkbox is checked.

defaultIndeterminate.description: Whether or not checkbox is indeterminate.

disabled.description: A checkbox can appear disabled and be unable to change states

fitted.description: Removes padding for a label. Auto applied when there is no label.

indeterminate.description: Whether or not checkbox is indeterminate.

toggle.description: Format to show an on or off choice.

input.description: Shorthand for creating the HTML Input.

inverted.description: Format to appear on dark backgrounds.

loading.description: An Icon Input field can show that it is currently loading data.

size.description: An Input can vary in size.

slider.description: Format to emphasize the current selection state.

toggle.description: Format to show an on or off choice.

src/components/controls/Search/Search.js.description: A search module allows a user to query for results from a selection of data

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

minCharacters.description: Minimum characters to query for results

noResultsDescription.description: Additional text for "No Results" message with less emphasis.

noResultsMessage.description: Message to display when there are no results.

open.description: Controls whether or not the results menu is displayed.

results.description:
One of:
- array of Search.Result props e.g. `{ title: '', description: '' }` or
- object of categories e.g. `{ name: '', results: [{ title: '', description: '' }]`

selectFirstResult.description: Whether the search should automatically select the first result after searching.

showNoResults.description: Whether a "no results" message should be shown if no results are found.

value.description: Current value of the search input. Creates a controlled component.

aligned.description: A search can have its results aligned to its left or right container edge.

category.description: A search can display results from remote content ordered by categories.

fluid.description: A search can have its results take up the width of its container.

input.description: A search input can take up the width of its container.

loading.description: A search can show a loading indicator.

size.description: A search can have different sizes.

active.description: The item currently selected by keyboard shortcut.

A TextArea can be used to allow for extended user input.
@see Form

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

autoHeight.description: Indicates whether height of the textarea fits the content or not.

src/components/layout/Divider/Divider.js.description: A divider visually segments content into groups.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

clearing.description: Divider can clear the content above it.

fitted.description: Divider can be fitted without any space above or below it.

hidden.description: Divider can divide content without creating a dividing line.

inverted.description: Divider can have it's colours inverted.

section.description: Divider can provide greater margins to divide sections of content.

src/components/layout/Grid/Grid.jsx.description: A grid is used to harmonize negative space in a layout.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

celled.description: A grid can have rows divided into cells.

centered.description: A grid can have its columns centered.

columns.description: Represents column count per row in Grid.

container.description: A grid can be combined with a container to use the available layout and alignment.

divided.description: A grid can have dividers between its columns.

doubling.description: A grid can double its column width on tablet and mobile sizes.

padded.description: A grid can preserve its vertical and horizontal gutters on first and last columns.

relaxed.description: A grid can increase its gutters to allow for more negative space.

reversed.description: A grid can specify that its columns should reverse order at different device sizes.

stackable.description: A grid can have its columns stack on-top of each other after reaching mobile breakpoints.

stretched.description: A grid can stretch its contents to take up the entire grid height.

textAlign.description: A grid can specify its text alignment.

verticalAlign.description: A grid can specify its vertical alignment to have all its columns vertically centered.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

color.description: A grid column can be colored.

computer.description: A column can specify a width for a computer.

floated.description: A column can sit flush against the left or right edge of a row.

largeScreen.description: A column can specify a width for a large screen device.

mobile.description: A column can specify a width for a mobile device.

only.description: A row can appear only for a specific device, or screen sizes.

stretched.description: A column can stretch its contents to take up the entire grid or row height.

tablet.description: A column can specify a width for a tablet device.

textAlign.description: A column can specify its text alignment.

verticalAlign.description: A column can specify its vertical alignment to have all its columns vertically centered.

widescreen.description: A column can specify a width for a wide screen device.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

centered.description: A row can have its columns centered.

color.description: A grid row can be colored.

columns.description: Represents column count per line in Row.

divided.description: A row can have dividers between its columns.

only.description: A row can appear only for a specific device, or screen sizes.

reversed.description: A row can specify that its columns should reverse order at different device sizes.

stretched.description: A row can stretch its contents to take up the entire column height.

textAlign.description: A row can specify its text alignment.

verticalAlign.description: A row can specify its vertical alignment to have all its columns vertically centered.

src/components/layout/Sidebar/Sidebar.js.description: A sidebar hides additional content beside a page.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

direction.description: Direction the sidebar should appear on.

visible.description: Controls whether or not the sidebar is visible on the page.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).
An element type to render as (string or function).

dimmed.description: Controls whether or not the dim is displayed.

src/components/media/Dimmer/Dimmer.jsx.description: A dimmer hides distractions to focus attention on particular content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: An active dimmer will dim its parent container.

disabled.description: A disabled dimmer cannot be activated

inverted.description: A dimmer can be formatted to have its colors inverted.

page.description: A dimmer can be formatted to be fixed to the page.

simple.description: A dimmer can be controlled with simple prop.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

blurring.description: A dimmable element can blur its contents.

dimmed.description: Controls whether or not the dim is displayed.

src/components/media/Embed/Embed.jsx.description: An embed displays content from other websites like YouTube videos or Google Maps.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

aspectRatio.description: An embed can specify an alternative aspect ratio.

autoplay.description: Setting to true or false will force autoplay.

brandedUI.description: Whether to show networks branded UI like title cards, or after video calls to action.

color.description: Specifies a default chrome color with Vimeo or YouTube.

hd.description: Whether to show networks branded UI like title cards, or after video calls to action.

icon.description: Specifies an icon to use with placeholder content.

url.description: Specifies a url to use for embed.

src/components/media/Icon/Icon.jsx.description:
An icon is a glyph used to represent something else.
@see Image

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

circular.description: Icon can formatted to appear circular.

corner.description: Icons can display a smaller corner icon.

disabled.description: Show that the icon is inactive.

fitted.description: Fitted, without space to left or right of Icon.

inverted.description: Formatted to have its colors inverted for contrast.

link.description: Icon can be formatted as a link.

loading.description: Icon can be used as a simple loader.

size.description: Size of the icon.

src/components/media/Icon/IconGroup.jsx.description: Several icons can be used together as a group.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

size.description: Size of the icon group.

src/components/media/Image/Image.jsx.description:
An image is a graphic representation of something.
@see Icon

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

alt.description: Alternate text for the image specified.

avatar.description: An image may be formatted to appear inline with text as an avatar.

bordered.description: An image may include a border to emphasize the edges of white or transparent content.

centered.description: An image can appear centered in a content block.

disabled.description: An image can show that it is disabled and cannot be selected.

floated.description: An image can sit to the left or right of other content.

fluid.description: An image can take up the width of its container.

href.description: Renders the Image as an <a> tag with this href.

shape.description: An image may appear rounded or circular.

size.description: An image may appear at different sizes.

spaced.description: An image can specify that it needs an additional spacing to separate it from nearby content.

src.description: Specifies the URL of the image.

ui.description: Whether or not to add the ui className.

verticalAlign.description: An image can specify its vertical alignment.

type.name: custom

wrapped.description: An image can render wrapped in a `div.ui.image` as alternative HTML markup.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

size.description: A group of images can be formatted to have the same size.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

attached.description: A label can attach to a content segment.

basic.description: A label can reduce its complexity.

corner.description: A label can position itself in the corner of an element.

empty.description: Formats the label as a dot.

floating.description: Float above another element in the upper right corner.

horizontal.description: A horizontal label is formatted to label content along-side it horizontally.

image.description: A label can be formatted to emphasize an image or prop can be used as shorthand for Image.

pointing.description: A label can point to content next to it.

removeIcon.description: Shorthand for Icon to appear as the last child and trigger onRemove.

ribbon.description: A label can appear as a ribbon attaching itself to an element.

size.description: A label can have different sizes.

tag.description: A label can appear as a tag.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).
An element type to render as (string or function).

color.description: Label group can share colors together.

size.description: Label group can share sizes together.

tag.description: Label group can share tag formatting.

src/components/media/Loader/Loader.jsx.description:
A loader alerts a user to wait for an activity to complete.
@see Dimmer

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: A loader can be active or visible.

disabled.description: A loader can be disabled or hidden.

indeterminate.description: A loader can show it's unsure of how long a task will take.

inline.description: Loaders can appear inline with content.

inverted.description: Loaders can have their colors inverted.

size.description: Loaders can have different sizes.

src/components/media/Popup/Popup.jsx.description: A Popup displays additional information on top of a page.

basic.description: Display the popup without the pointing arrow.

content.description: Simple text content for the popover.

flowing.description: A flowing Popup has no maximum width and continues to flow to fit its content.

header.description: Header displayed above the content in bold.

hideOnScroll.description: Hide the Popup when scrolling the window.

hoverable.description: Whether the popup should not close on hover.

inverted.description: Invert the colors of the Popup.

offset.description: Horizontal offset in pixels to be applied to the Popup.

size.description: Popup size.

trigger.description: Element to be rendered in-place where the popup is defined.

src/components/media/Popup/PopupContent..description: A PopupContent displays the content body of a Popover.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

className.description: Classes to add to the Popup content className.

src/components/media/Popup/PopupHeader.j.description: A PopupHeader displays a header in a Popover.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/media/Rating/Rating.jsx.description: A rating indicates user interest in content.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

clearable.description:
You can clear the rating by clicking on the current start rating.
By default a rating will be only clearable if there is 1 icon.
Setting to `true`/`false` will allow or disallow a user to clear their rating.

disabled.description: You can disable or enable interactive rating.  Makes a read-only rating.

icon.description: A rating can use a set of star or heart icons.

rating.description: The current number of active icons.

size.description: A progress bar can vary in size.

src/components/media/Rating/RatingIcon.j.description: An internal icon sub-component for Rating component

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

index.description: An index of icon inside Rating.

src/components/navigation/Menu/Menu.jsx.description:
A menu displays grouped navigation actions.
@see Dropdown

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

activeIndex.description: Index of the currently active item.

attached.description: A menu may be attached to other content segments.

borderless.description: A menu item or menu can have no borders.

compact.description: A menu can take up only the space necessary to fit its content.

fixed.description: A menu can be fixed to a side of its context.

fluid.description: A vertical menu may take the size of its container.

icon.description: A menu may have just icons (bool) or labeled icons.

inverted.description: A menu may have its colors inverted to show greater contrast.

items.description: Shorthand array of props for Menu.

pagination.description: A pagination menu is specially formatted to present links to pages of content.

pointing.description: A menu can point to show its relationship to nearby content.

secondary.description: A menu can adjust its appearance to de-emphasize its contents.

size.description: A menu can vary in size.

stackable.description: A menu can stack at mobile resolutions.

tabular.description: A menu can be formatted to show tabs of information.

text.description: A menu can be formatted for text content.

vertical.description: A vertical menu displays elements vertically.

widths.description: A menu can have its items divided evenly.

src/components/navigation/Menu/MenuHeade.description: A menu item may include a header or may itself be a header.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

src/components/navigation/Menu/MenuItem..description: A menu can contain an item.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

active.description: A menu item can be active.

disabled.description: A menu item can be disabled.

fitted.description: A menu item or menu can remove element padding, vertically or horizontally.

header.description: A menu item may include a header or may itself be a header.

link.description: A menu item can be link.

position.description: A menu item can take right position.

src/components/navigation/Menu/MenuMenu..description: A menu can contain a sub menu.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

position.description: A sub menu can take right position.

closeOnDocumentClick.description: Controls whether or not the portal should close when the document is clicked.

closeOnEscape.description: Controls whether or not the portal should close when escape is pressed is displayed.

closeOnPortalMouseLeave.description:
Controls whether or not the portal should close when mousing out of the portal.
NOTE: This will prevent `closeOnTriggerMouseLeave` when mousing over the
gap from the trigger to the portal.

closeOnRootNodeClick.description:
Controls whether or not the portal should close on a click on the portal background.
NOTE: This differs from closeOnDocumentClick:
- DocumentClick - any click not within the portal
- RootNodeClick - a click not within the portal but within the portal's wrapper

closeOnTriggerBlur.description: Controls whether or not the portal should close on blur of the trigger.

closeOnTriggerClick.description: Controls whether or not the portal should close on click of the trigger.

closeOnTriggerMouseLeave.description: Controls whether or not the portal should close when mousing out of the trigger.

mountNode.description: The node where the portal should mount.

mouseLeaveDelay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing on mouse leave

mouseEnterDelay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening on mouse over

open.description: Controls whether or not the portal is displayed.

openOnTriggerClick.description: Controls whether or not the portal should open when the trigger is clicked.

openOnTriggerFocus.description: Controls whether or not the portal should open on focus of the trigger.

openOnTriggerMouseEnter.description: Controls whether or not the portal should open when mousing over the trigger.

prepend.description: Controls whether the portal should be prepended to the mountNode instead of appended.

trigger.description: Element to be rendered in-place where the portal is defined.

src/components/text/Heading/Heading.jsx.description: A heading provides a short summary of content

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).

attached.description: Attach heading  to other content, like a segment.

block.description: Format heading to appear inside a content block.

disabled.description: Show that the heading is inactive.

dividing.description: Divide heading from the content below it.

floated.description: Heading can sit to the left or right of other content.

icon.description: Add an icon by icon name or pass an Icon.

image.description: Add an image by img src or pass an Image.

inverted.description: Inverts the color of the heading for dark backgrounds.

size.description: Content headings are sized with em and are based on the font-size of their container.

sub.description: Headings may be formatted to label smaller or de-emphasized content.

src/components/text/Heading/HeadingConte.description: Heading content wraps the main content when there is an adjacent Icon or Image.

as.description: An element type to render as (string or function).
An element type to render as (string or function).
